newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: MISS S.AFRICA SPARKS ROW OVER ANIMAL SACRIFICE.
newsitem.headline: MISS S.AFRICA SPARKS ROW OVER ANIMAL SACRIFICE.

text.p: Animal lovers taking pets on a Sunday fun-run told their celebrity guest, Miss South Africa, to stay away after she said she would sacrifice a goat to her ancestors.
Peggy-Sue Khumalo, 23, told a weekly magazine that if she won November's Miss World contest in India, she would also slaughter a cow and even 10 oxen to thank the spirits for her success.

"Because of her involvement in ritual slaughter, which does cause suffering to animals, we have asked her to stand down," a spokesman for the Animal Anti-cruelty league, that organised the Johannesburg fun run, told the Sunday Times.
Khumalo said she grew up on a farm and would never abuse animals.
"In my culture we slaughter an animal as an act of gratitude," she said. "Slaughtering should be carried out in a humane manner, causing minimal suffering."
